I wander past the orchard, follow the fence line, and keep rambling without settling anywhere specific.

Starting from inn we walked into kitchen filled with smoke, bypassed pantry stacked with bread, followed passage out to rear courtyard, passed empty guard post, and ended our steps inside armory where weapons gleamed under torchlight.

We left tavrn at dawn, stumbled into crowded market where vendors shouted and smoke from grills filled the air, crossed plaza buzzing with jugglers, paused near chapel doors but didn’t enter, circled the old well, and finally descended spiral steps into dungeon dark and cold.
with her arm around my waist, we walked into the castle yard
We skipped the porch, went past the well, and met in the chapel nave beside the candles.
We set off from guild hall, talked about chapel, then saloon, but in truth it was only imagination, we just kept writing locations in chat and never arrived anywhere real.

Our path began at castle gate, then through courtyard crowded with guards, quick step past gallery of portraits, down corridor to throne room where silence pressed, detour into archive heavy with dust, and after long searching we ended hidden in armory stacked with steel.
